title: "We understand you want to play Smite Support Nunu, but your teammates don't."
body: Looks like Riot can either go back and unban him saying his ban is unfair and they were wrong or they can start enforcing support to be the adcs bitch all game long or risk a ban.

Just to play devil's advocate:

Sitting around in bot lane is not equal to supporting.

Supporting at a high level requires a good support to constantly roam any time they can push the lane up to secure deep vision and pincer gank mid lane and the enemy jungler. A good support in high level play will leave his adc alone in lane as often as is possible to do safely so that the adc can acquire solo experience.

The reality is that playing support at a high level requires one to understand when to babysit the adc and when to be doing actual support things to control the map.

The issue is how broad the term support really is. You can support other lanes and not strictly bot. Along with it he is playing Nunu and abusing Nunus rather strong counter jungle power. If you look into his OP.GG on his Nunu games you will find a majority of them are victories and with it he actually outlevels the enemy jungler/support while his ADC outlevels the enemy adc. This is a massive way to win games just by raw power as he is giving his team the highest possible expereince lead. 

He isn't playing support in the traditional league sense however in more of a Dota esque style where he roams and helps everyone while hindering an enemy player. Should his bot laner not be able to play safe and simply disregard they are in a bad situation it can lead to issues.

Along with this he is forcing the enemy support into an uncomfortable position where they must either roam and make sure they help other lanes like a second jungler or they have to stay bot and know that both them and their ally laner will fall behind in EXP. 

In my opinion it is a brilliant strategy.

Except you're not supporting other lanes. That's like saying the Jungler is supporting the other lanes.

Support isn't that broad when you define it as assisting a specific teammate through their time of weakness hit their powerspike unhurt.

By duo jungling he isn't supporting the other lanes, if anything he's just supporting his primary jungler because he's making their job easier.

I don't hate on the strategy, but what I am against is the definition of the role being muddled up. This stratagem is simply duo jungle. Not support counterjungling all game. Now that it is called that, the whole "Nunu off-meta banned Rito Sux" angle of the argument goes out the window. Now we focus on whether or not his team was okay with the _role of Jungler #2, not "support" because that is not what he did._

Keep in mind he clearly hasn't the potential to. 

Support can be seen as this yes however it is also aiding one team while hindering an enemy. 

He is still supporting someone.

There comes an issue with the current champion selection and any off role type deal such as this is instantly impossible to do as you're clearly limited in what you can and cannot do. There is no feasible way to select yourself as a secondary jungler whose goal is to counterjungle and gank lanes. There is no option for this thus changing the set idea of the support role to a roaming supportive jungler is the only way to even get by with it. Should this of been in the old pick system (You know that mess where pick order was the way to go) it would have been possible but due to Riots change of this system he again cannot play the game in his own method (which clearly works by his 56% winrate).

The biggest issue here is how Riot has handled the meta and it simply can't be changed at the moment as the game has grown around it. While strategies like this do work and can be quite effecient they simply are banworthy as you don't play X role the way X role was formed to be.

Except he can just duo with an ADC that doesn't mind to 1v2. Problem solved.

> Support can be seen as this yes however it is also aiding one team while hindering an enemy.

By that logic a traditional bot lane support is supporting the entire team because he is ensuring their lategame ticket to a win is well protected.

Also by that logic a Jungler can be classified as a Support as well.

But that's not how this works. Keep in mind that a support can roam, but there is such a thing as roaming too much.

Also another side of the issue you failed to mention is that the _commnuity_ started this by their crusade against trollpicks and their reporting of this Nunu enough times for the IFS to get him banned in the first place. Riot is literally just upholding this.

IMO, this is proof that Riot can't trust the community to decide what trolling is.

They should bring back the Tribunal to handle trolling cases like this because this is too subjective for an automated system to handle.

But how do you even queue for duo jungle in Master+? It isn't an option. Fact is if he opens up an easier game for the other lanes, he is supporting his team, even if he isn't sitting in the botlane. 

I am not saying his gameplay is perfect. I am just saying he has no other way to even get to play double jungle.

He can easily duo with an guy who plays bot who doesn't mind the 1v2 bot lane. Problem solved.

Also by that logic a jungler supports his team as well. 

And I am not saying that this game strategy is stupid or trolling. I am calling it like it is. It is a duo jungle strategy. So we shouldn't call it Support Nunu. We should call it Jungle #2 Nunu and work from there.

Eventually he won't be allowed to duo-que. What then?

It is double-jungle, but that isn't an option to queue up as. And queueing as jungle is definitely not the same thing.
